title: TC001-User Registration with Valid Data
description: Verify that a user can successfully register with valid email, password, and required fields.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173/", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Find and click the Register page link or button to navigate to the registration form.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, 300)
        

        # -> Scroll down more to find any navigation links or buttons related to registration or login.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, 500)
        

        # -> Try to navigate directly to common registration URL /register or /signup to access the registration form.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:5173/register', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # -> Try to navigate to the login page /login to check if registration link or form is available there.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:5173/login', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Registration Completed Successfully! Please check your email to verify your account.').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError('Test case failed: Registration success message and email verification prompt were not found, indicating the registration process did not complete as expected.')
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173/", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Find and click the Cart page link or button to go to the Cart page.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on the Cart link or button to navigate to the Cart page
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Book successfully removed from cart')).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError('Test case failed: The book was not removed from the cart and the cart totals did not update correctly as expected.')
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC025-Error Handling for Network Failures
description: Verify that network errors during operations like login, book fetch, checkout display user-friendly error messages without breaking UI.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173/", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Locate and open the login form to simulate network failure on login API call.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, 300)
        

        # -> Scroll down further to find login or book fetch elements to simulate network failure.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, 500)
        

        # -> Try to navigate to login page or open login modal if available via any visible navigation or menu elements.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, -300)
        

        # -> Attempt direct navigation to /login page to access login form for network failure simulation.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:5173/login', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # -> Try to navigate to the main page or book listing page to find book fetch or add to cart UI elements for network failure simulation.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:5173/books', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # -> Scroll down the page to check if any hidden or off-screen UI elements related to books or cart appear.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, 400)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        try:
            await expect(page.locator('text=Network connection is perfect').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError('Test failed: Network errors during login, book fetch, or checkout did not display user-friendly error messages or the UI broke, violating the test plan requirements.')
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())
